feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 9:41PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...MULTIPLE HEAVY RAIN EVENTS TO ARRIVE FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... Multiple weather fronts are expected to move into the Southeast Alaska forecast area from Friday to Wednesday. The Northeast Gulf will already be saturated with rains from midweek, and lighter rains spreading into the panhandle Thursday will begin to prime the remainder of the panhandle region.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Misty Fjords; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 4:31PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS AND HIGH SURF EXPECTED FROM KIPNUK TO THE MOUTH OF THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER THURSDAY... A cold front will track across the eastern Bering late Wednesday into Thursday. Southerly wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph are expected along the Kuskokwim Delta coast and across Kuskokwim Bay. High surf of 1 to 3 feet above the normal highest tide line is possible

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 2:37PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 12:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by elevated river levels will continue into the weekend. * WHERE...The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. * WHEN...Until 500 PM AKDT Saturday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 11:29AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RISING WATER LEVELS ON SMALL STREAMS AND CREEKS DRAINING THE BROOKS RANGE... A series of fronts will impact the region, bringing copious amounts of widespread rain that will cause water levels to rise on small streams and creeks draining the south slopes of the Western Brooks Range.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 11:29AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..ELEVATED SURF LIKELY ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY... Strong south winds to 25 to 40 mph will move into the West Coast and bring elevated surf to parts of Norton Sound and the Yukon Delta on Thursday, persisting into Friday before they diminish. Wave action will combine with storm surge and be the greatest along south facing coastlines, with anticipated storm surge
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 1:35AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog This Morning... Patchy dense fog is expected along and near the coast this morning with locally poor visibility. Visibility may be reduce to one quarter mile or less at times. If you have travel plans, be aware that the visibility may drop rapidly over short distances. Slow down, use your low beam headlights, and leave plenty of distance

entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Texas... Trinity River Near Rosser affecting Kaufman and Ellis Counties. For the Trinity River...including Dallas, Rosser, Trinidad, Long Lake (Oakwood)...elevated river levels are forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued August 23 at 8:22PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: .A slow moving low pressure system will support afternoon thunderstorms. The storms will be stationary to slow moving, allowing for heavy rain amounts over small areas causing flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING...

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued August 23 at 4:13PM PDT until August 26 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO MIDNIGHT PDT THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Hot conditions with temperatures in the mid 80s to low 90s expected. This will pose a moderate risk of heat-related illness. * WHERE...Northwest Interior, Everett and Vicinity, Tacoma Area,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bellevue and Vicinity; Bremerton and Vicinity; East Puget Sound Lowlands; Everett and Vicinity; Hood Canal Area; Lower Chehalis Valley Area; Seattle and Vicinity; Southwest Interior; Tacoma Area; Western Skagit County; Western Whatcom County

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 24 at 3:13AM CDT until August 24 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous swimming conditions are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline due to high wave action and strong rip currents. * WHERE...Minnesota Park Point and Wisconsin Point Beaches.
